sentences.sentence: The Fisherman and his Wife
There was once a fisherman who lived in a hovel( 破败的小屋 ) by the sea side with his wife, Isabel.
The hovel’s roof( 房顶 ) leaked( 渗漏 ) and its floor was made out of mud( 泥 ), so it was not much better than living outside.
The fisherman went out every day with his hook( 鱼钩 ) and line to catch fish.
He fished from before daylight till after dark, and when he caught something, he and his wife ate fish, and when he did not, they went hungry.
One day he was sitting with his fishing rod( 杆 ) and looking into the clear water.
He had been sitting there for a very long time, when suddenly the line went down to the bottom of the water.
When he pulled the line in, he found a great fish on the hook. And the fish said to him,
“Fisherman, listen to me! Let me go, I am not a real fish but an enchanted( 中了魔法的 ) prince( 王子 ).
What good shall I be to you if you take me away from the water? I do not taste good, so put me back into the water again, and let me swim away.”
“Well,” said the fisherman, “there is no need of so many words about it. How could I kill a fish that can talk? Whether you taste good or not, I will let you go now, anyway.”
Then he put the fish back into the clear water.
The fish swam down to the bottom, leaving a long streak( 条痕 ) of blood behind him.
Then the fisherman got up and went home to his wife in their hovel.
“Well, husband,” said the wife, “haven’t you caught anything today?”
“No,” said the man, “that is, I did catch a fish, but he said he was an enchanted prince, and I let him go.”
“Then, did you wish for anything?” said the wife.
“No,” said the man, “what should I wish for?”
“It is so dreadful( 糟糕的 ) always to live in this bad-smelling hovel. You should have wished for a little cottage( 小别墅 ).
Go again and call him. Tell him we want a little cottage. Probably he will give it to us; go, and be quick.”
And when he went back, the sea was green and yellow, and not nearly so clear. So he stood and said,
“Precious( 珍稀的 ) magic fish,
Greatest of all fishes!
What I would not wish
My wife, Isabel, wishes.”
Then the fish came swimming up, and said,
“Now, what does she want?”
“Oh,” said the man, “when I caught you, my wife says I ought to have wished for something. She does not want to live any longer in the hovel, and would rather have a cottage.”
“Go home,” said the fish. “She has it already.”
So the man went home, and found, instead of the hovel, a little cottage.
His wife was sitting on a bench( 长凳 ) before the door. And she took him by the hand, and said to him,
“Come in and see if this is not a great improvement( 改善 ).”
So they went in, and there was a living room and a beautiful little bedroom( 卧室 ), a kitchen, and a place to store their food.
There was furniture( 家具 ) of all kinds, and good quality iron and brass( 黄铜 ) cooking pots( 锅 ).
And at the back was a little yard with chickens and ducks, and a little garden full of green vegetables and fruit.
“Look,” said the wife, “isn’t that nice?”
“Yes,” said the man, “I am sorry I doubted you: this cottage is indeed much better than the hovel we lived in before. I think we can live very happily here now.”
“We will see about that,” said the wife. And after a meal they went to bed.
So all went well for a week or two, when the wife said,
“Husband, the cottage is really too small, and we need a bigger garden.
I think the fish should get us a larger house.
I should like very much to live in a large stone castle( 城堡 ).
Go to your fish and he will give us a castle.”
“Oh my dear wife,” said the man, “the cottage is good enough; what do we want a castle for?”
“We want one,” said the wife; “go along with you; the fish can give us one.”
“Now, wife,” said the man, “the fish gave us the cottage. I do not like to go to him again. He may be angry.”
“Go along,” said the wife. “Why shouldn’t he give it to us, after you spared his life? Do as I say!”
The man really did not want to go.
He said to himself, “This is not the right thing to do.” But he went anyway.

question.cn: 如果渔夫什么都没钓到，将会发生什么？
question.en: What would happen if the fisherman caught nothing?

options.cn: 他们会吃以前储存的食物。
options.en: They would eat food that they had stored before.

options.cn: 他们会从邻居那里借食物。
options.en: They would borrow food from neighbors.

analysis: 文中提到：“He fished from before daylight till after dark, and when he caught something, he and his wife ate fish, and when he did not, they went hungry.”因此答案选B。
